property.name: text
property.value: Position of the participant while measuring resting HR and BP

property.name: text
property.value: Explain why a CPET was not performed:

property.name: text
property.value: Did the patient take a beta-blocker today?

property.name: text
property.value: Did the patient take a calcium channel blocker today?

property.name: text
property.value: What criteria was formally used to end the protocol?

property.name: text
property.value: Which chronotropic index formula was used for calculation?

property.name: description
property.value: Non beta-blocker CI = (peak HR – resting HR) / ((220-age) – resting HR) Beta-blocker CI = (peak HR – resting HR) / ((164-0.72*age) – resting HR) Heart failure CI = (peak HR - resting HR)/(119+(resting HR/2) - (age/2) - 5 - resting HR)

property.name: text
property.value: Effort of Study: Was maximum effort achieved?

property.name: description
property.value: Normal = at least 10 beat per minute increase (no beta-blocker) or at least 5 beats per minute increase (on beta-blocker); using Bruce protocol

property.name: text
property.value: Peak oxygen pulse (peak VO2 mL/min divided by peak HR)

property.name: description
property.value: See age and sex adjusted norms from Annals ATS Abnormal if below the range

property.name: description
property.value: Normal is for BP to rise during test Abnormal is fall in systolic BP >20 mmHg from the highest peak sBP during the test

property.name: description
property.value: Normal = less than 34 at anaerobic threshold (from ATS/ACCP Statement on Cardiopulmonary Exercise Testing)

property.name: description
property.value: Yes: > 1 mm ST depression (horizontal or downsloping) See Fletcher, Circulation 2013: “The standard criteria for test positivity include horizontal or downsloping ST depression ≥1 mm (0.1 mV) at 60 to 80 ms after the J point “
